intro: Horkelia campestris, commonly known as the field horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Horkelia campestris is often found in association with other native wildflowers in its native range.
